pull.title: remove 'label' filter for rpc command help
pull.body: No idea why it's there(which gives me some pause) since it's a sourceforge-era commit, but it seems useless and filters out any command with "label" in the name.

events.body:
Eh yes this is old cruft, we certainly don't want to remove *label* commands from the help. 
You've potentially saved me a hour of frustrating debugging for #7729.
utACK https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9894/commits/91321e63e0dbdabae682b7455329fded8aa576af.

events.message: remove 'label' filter for rpc command help

events.body:
Removed the comment as well.

I was a bit surprised that this had never come up for #7729, heh

Tested ACK https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9894/commits/666597798c07d9df06681be63d2b2f51f0d5ca8a

Travis has been timing out all day. The failure isn't due to this PR.
For historical reference: IIRC, the RPCs were originally *label*, and had been replaced by the account variants.

> For historical reference: IIRC, the RPCs were originally label, and had been replaced by the account variants.

Interesting. So we're going full circle.

issue.title: rpc: remove 'label' filter for rpc command help
issue.body:
Backport upstream fix for a very old irrelevant check.

Ref: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/9894

comments.body: It used to have other deprecated commands, long-ago deleted. I'm not actually sure what the comment is trying to say. (no commits to be seen on git makes it harder)
Yes please remove the comment too
